Award.AwardTitle: The First Minerals, Metals & Materials Society (TMS) Summit on Integrated Manufacturing and Materials Innovations; Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; November 15-18, 2015

Division.LongName: Div Of Civil, Mechanical, & Manufact Inn

Award.AbstractNarration:
This grant will help support the attendance of fifteen graduate students and ten post-doctoral researchers or early-career faculty at the inaugural The Minerals, Metals, and Materials Society (TMS) Summit on Integrated Manufacturing and Materials Innovations to be held in November 2015 in Pittsburgh, PA. This forum will provide an environment for rich discussions and interactions to not only assess the state-of-the-art in materials-related manufacturing innovations, but also to roadmap the key areas of future directions for the field.

The conference will bring together scientists, engineers and decision makers from academia, industry and government. The key technical theme will be the integration of materials and manufacturing innovations. The summit will provide a forum for presentations and discussions on materials-related manufacturing topics including digital manufacturing, Integrated Computational Engineering (ICME), hybrid manufacturing processes, nanomaterials, sustainable manufacturing and additive manufacturing to name a few. The outcomes will be identification of technological and economic limitations and barriers to implementation as well as a roadmap for key areas for future development.

POR.DRECONTENT:
There is mounting pressure within industry and society to move advanced products out the door faster, cheaper and at a higher quality. This has given rise to numerous initiatives throughout the world focused on innovations in manufacturing. The 1st TMS Summit on Integrated Manufacturing and Materials Innovations, which was held November 15-18, 2015 in Pittsburgh Pennsylvania, provided a key forum where scientists, engineers, students, and decision makers could interact, report, and develop productive linkages concerning materials-related manufacturing innovations. More specifically, manufacturing technologies are greatly enhanced by innovations in the development of new materials and processes for making parts and components associated with a variety of products and systems. The summit examined solutions for applications in both established and emerging industries, with a key technical theme as the integration of materials and manufacturing innovations. The major activities of this conference revolved around the 117 attendees, 54 strong technical presentations, interactive panel discussions, and an exhibit by companies. As the integration of materials and manufacturing innovations continues to evolve, it is becoming increasingly common to achieve new levels of product properties, performance, manufacturing efficiency and affordability, and applications, and the knowledge exchanged at this summit should help in paving the way for such breakthroughs.
